post1.title: Career Change: A 'Loss' or a 'Gain'? A Coach's Perspective
post1.excerpt: Exploring the complex emotions that come with making a significant professional shift.

article.p1: When clients come to coaching considering a career change, they often focus on the 'gain' â€“ a new title, more flexibility, or more meaningful work. This is the exciting part. But any change, even a positive one, involves a 'loss'.
article.p2: What might be lost? Familiarity. A clear identity. The comfort of expertise. Financial stability. It's often the unacknowledged grief for these 'losses' that keeps us stuck, not the fear of the new 'gain'.
article.quote: A coaching space allows us to name these losses without judgement, to honour what was, so we can fully step into what's next.
article.p3: So, the question isn't just "What do I want to gain?". It's also, "What am I willing to let go of?" and "How can I honour the transition?"
